intimate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: private and friendly so that you feel comfortable
intimate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: the intimate atmosphere of a country pub
The collection has been moved from its intimate setting to the British Museum.
intimate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
intimate.translation[0].definitions[2].d: relating to very private or personal matters
intimate.translation[0].definitions[2].e: the publication of intimate details of their affair
intimate.translation[0].definitions[3].e: The virus can only be transmitted through intimate contact.
intimate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly
intimate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: He intimated, politely but firmly, that we were not welcome.
She had already intimated to me her wish to leave.
